intro: Torularia humilis f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed torularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a low-growing, perennial grass that typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to yellowish flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The botanical characteristics of this variety make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
